image.altText: Two men sitting on chairs

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy have met for the first time since their infamous February Oval Office stoush, amid protracted US-led attempts to broker a ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine.

title.children: Trump meets Zelenskyy at Pope's funeral, then blasts Putin on social media

image.altText: A woman closes her eyes while standing between two men

props.synopsis: Pope Francis may have been a humble man beloved by Catholics around the world, but his funeral was still a star-studded affair. These were the key moments you missed.

title.children: The Pope's funeral featured royals, mourners and a surprise meeting

image.altText: Close up Albanese, smiling, scaffolding in background.

props.synopsis: The crucible of a campaign tests who has what it takes to be a leader. With less than a week to go, we're starting to who has passed the test.

title.children: Albanese eyes history — unless Dutton pulls off a last-minute miracle

image.altText: Q+A/YouGov Poll 28 April 2025

props.synopsis: Most Australians believe the United States can no longer be relied on for security in a "fundamental change of worldview", research for Q+A shows.

title.children: 'Trump won't save us': Australians' radical shift on US relations

image.altText: a man wearing army uniform speaking at a lectern

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's anti-corruption watchdog has been repeatedly photographed in full military regalia since taking on the $780,000 a year role.

title.children: Anti-corruption watchdog boss's defence links spark impartiality concerns

image.altText: A gas flare with a line graph indicating gas prices

props.synopsis: Gas has been making lots of headlines throughout this election campaign. As we enter the final week, there are a few things to know about gas, how much of it we use, and what role it plays in our power bills.

title.children: The six things you should know about gas and if it can make power cheaper

image.altText: Albanese democracy sausage Tasmania

props.synopsis: The $200 million election commitment rebrands and expands an existing health hotline.

title.children: Labor promises free 24/7 health advice in further Medicare pledge

image.altText: A woman in bushland looking away from the camera

props.synopsis: Vaccine Nation is a warning about the acceleration of the anti-vaccination movement during the pandemic and worrying declines in vaccination rates around the world. Can we correct course before it's too late?

title.children: How COVID antivaxxers fuelled a worrying backlash to a life-saving science

image.altText: Police arresting a man near a tram

props.synopsis: Clashes between protesters and police in Melbourne lead to two arrests, with chaos spilling out onto CBD streets.

title.children: Two arrested following fiery protests in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: Smoke from an explosion is seen at a port in Iran

props.synopsis: The blast happened at the Shahid Rajaei port just outside a major facility for container shipments for the Islamic Republic that handles some 80 million tons of goods annually.

title.children: Several dead and hundreds injured in Iran port explosion

image.altText: Virginia Roberts Giuffre

props.synopsis: She exposed the elite and broke her silence — now she's gone, but her story refuses to die.

title.children: Staring down the elite, Virginia Giuffre refused to be silenced

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Looking for a chance to embarrass yourself? Today's your lucky day.

title.children: Like a quiz with a serving of sass? Come on in. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: Kristy Alleson

props.synopsis: In the upcoming federal election, there are five seats in regional Australia that could influence the overall result. Here's why they matter.

title.children: Five seats that could change the course of the election

image.altText: Large billboard of man with politcal slogans

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli has hit out at "young thugs" he says are taunting the government on social media.

title.children: Queensland premier says 'bring it on' to 'young thugs' in taunting videos

image.altText: Peter Dutton Laura Tingle

props.synopsis: We have a sometimes mystifying relationship with ideas about honouring those who serve our country, and with ideas about how we defend it.

title.children: Australia needs to answer urgent questions about its defence budget

image.altText: A cute dog

props.synopsis: The beloved miniature dachshund, who disappeared on a South Australian island 529 days ago, has been found safe and well by wildlife rescuers.

title.children: Missing sausage dog 'finally safe' after 17 months on island

image.altText: a close up of Pope Francis's hand, wearing a silver oval-like ring with a cross etched into it

props.synopsis: Despite Pope Francis opting for a simpler, humbler papacy compared to his predecessors, his death is not without ceremony. Let's unpack some of the symbols and rituals that come with farewelling the leader of the Catholic Church.

title.children: The deep symbolism and rituals surrounding the death of a pope

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman with short black hair, graying at the roots wearing a pink polo shirt sitting in front of her home.

props.synopsis: When Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visited the NT community to announce $4 billion to improve remote housing, the community were hopeful. But a year later, no new homes have been built.

title.children: Not one new home in Binjari where Albanese made $4b housing promise

image.altText: CECOT inmates

props.synopsis: At CECOT in El Salvador there are no family visits, no access to the outdoors, no rehabilitation programs.

title.children: Inside El-Salvador's mega-prison for gangs and Trump deportees

image.altText: GettyImages-2211407119

props.synopsis: Jason Horne-Francis has been defended by his coach and captain after the Port Adelaide player was involved in a skirmish during his team's nine-point win over North Melbourne.

title.children: 'Cage a raging bull': Horne-Francis clashes with old team in fiery clash

image.altText: Nathan Cleary look towards the big screen during an NRL match

props.synopsis: The Penrith Panthers, winners of the past four NRL competitions, will end the round eight bottom of the ladder after losing to Manly at Western Sydney Stadium.

title.children: 'Disappointing' Panthers fall to bottom of the NRL with another loss

image.altText: A man looking at a cassowary walking by.

props.synopsis: A devastating cyclone helped Kenn Parker build his rainforest home, and now his favourite neighbours are the cassowaries who come to visit with their chicks.

title.children: The house that Yasi built: One man's solitary life with the cassowaries

image.altText: A woman with brown hair sat behind a desk

props.synopsis: The US Marshals Service confirmed Hannah Dugan, a Milwaukee County circuit judge, was arrested at the courthouse where she works.

title.children: FBI arrests judge over allegations she obstructed immigration arrest

image.altText: A close up of a man's face

props.synopsis: We spoke to two experts to answer questions about what recourse the judiciary has when its authority is tested by the executive branch.

title.children: What happens if Trump officials defy the Supreme Court?

image.altText: A man in black is at the bottom centre of the image with two flags looming behind him

props.synopsis: It has been 11 years since Russia took control of the Crimean Peninsula. Here is what we know about what to expect next.

title.children: Russia has spent centuries fighting for Crimea, but Zelenskyy wants it too

image.altText: Decklen Deaves-Thornton, 22, has been charged with murder

props.synopsis: Decklen Deaves-Thornton is accused of the shooting murder of 18-year-old Ekampreet Sahni Singh in a car park at Bar Beach on Wednesday.

title.children: Man accused of teen's murder 'remorseful' as hundreds attend vigil

image.altText: Headshot of Aunty Joy wearing classes and a possum fur coat.

props.synopsis: Wurundjeri elder Aunty Joy Murphy Wandin was due to walk out onto the field at the Storm vs Rabbitohs match alongside Aboriginal women from the Djirri Djirri dance group.

title.children: Elder heartbroken over 'hurtful' cancelling of NRL Welcome to Country

image.altText: Wests Tigers coach Benji Marshall pulls a face as he walks away from a press conference at training.

props.synopsis: Tigers coach Benji Marshall says he does not care if people question his decision to recall departing five-eighth Lachlan Galvin to the Wests Tigers first grade side after just one match in reserve grade.

title.children: Marshall 'sick of talking' about Galvin saga on eve of NRL recall

image.altText: A hand holds a lit cigarette

props.synopsis: With a packet of tobacco costing more than $100, smokers in Tjuntjuntjarra are in a vicious cycle, but have "little support" when it comes to quitting.

title.children: Almost everyone smokes in this community and locals want that to change

image.altText: A woman swings a golf club during a round

props.synopsis: A sublime front nine has propelled Minjee Lee into contention at the halfway point of the biggest women's golf event of the year thus far.

title.children: Lee surges at Chevron Championship with brilliant second round

image.altText: Composite image of Alexei Popyrin and Daria Kasatkina.

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin and Chris O'Connell are knocked out of the Madrid Open, while Daria Kasatkina — who recently switched her allegiance to Australia — wins through to the round of 32.

title.children: Aussies produce mixed fortunes at Madrid Open

image.altText: A chart shows the breakdown of energy generation over the course of a day, including coal, gas and renewables

props.synopsis: Our energy system is evolving at breakneck speed. Here we look at how our power grid works, what more renewables mean for energy prices, how nuclear fits into the picture, and how we might build a grid fit for the future.

title.children: What might our future power grid look like? This illustrated guide explains

image.altText: photo taken through gap from inside building shows cars and the floor covered with pigeon excrement and feathers

props.synopsis: Locals in a South Australian town known for its silo art fear visitors are being driven away by the "toxic" smell created by hundreds of pigeons roosting in a derelict building.

title.children: Country town furious over 'pigeon palace' poo problem

image.altText: Two men in firefighting uniforms stand in front of two red firetrucks.

props.synopsis: The transition from military service to a career in firefighting is a natural fit for many in the Australian Army, a former commando says, describing it as "going from one family to another".

title.children: 'From one family to another': Commando finds fresh start in firefighting
